utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, no, no.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Lucy, I’m home!

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Ricky!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Hello, darling!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lucy should have told me we have company.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: That costs extra.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, according to your little mechanical friend here, you have been drowning your sorrows in frozen pizza, online shopping -

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And Dolph Lundgren marathons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Et tu, Lucy? Is nothing private?

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Not without the proper setting.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling. I – I know it’s difficult for you without Katherine, but really? Isn’t it a little early in the day for this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are for Ryan and Esposito. They get the results of their sergeants’ exam today, so I thought I’d drop down to the precinct, surprise them later on.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And if Beckett happens to be there –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All the more reason to celebrate.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, so any word on the exam?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop it!

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: You’re gonna jinx it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Done. Hey, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who is this?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Justin Fletcher, 38. Two GSWs to the chest, close range.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea when this happened?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Around 10:14 AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, that’s pretty specific.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s when 911 received an anonymous call from a witness.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tech’s trying to trace it now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that’s our victim’s car?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Keys were in his pocket. We’re just digging into it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then this wasn’t a carjacking.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or a robbery. Victim still had his cash and wallet on him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are bulletproof windows, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s not the only upgrade. These tires are reinforced run-flat and there are Kevlar panels in these doors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do you think? Maybe he was corporate security?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not with that tiny backseat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I mean, there’s no room for a guy to get in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m just going to step –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay. Wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the plot thickens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, why don’t you get CSU to sweep this. Maybe they can tell us what our victim was hiding here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Might be what he was killed for.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Is that the test results?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. No! Tech got a name and address on that anonymous 911 call. Mia Laszlo. Address in Battery Park.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Pick her up.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ms. Laszlo? I’m Detective Esposi-

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: - Detective Esposito, this is Detective Ryan. We want to ask you a few questions about that murder you reported. Can we come in?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Excuse me, ma’am, we still need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: There is a reason it was an anonymous call.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You witnessed a murder. So you either let us in to talk or we can drag you down to the station.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Just a minute.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Okay, listen closely. This is how this is going to go. I ride in the back seat, alone. And the windows stay down the whole way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you think of anyone who would’ve wanted to kill your brother?

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: No, everybody loved Justin. He was such a good guy. He left the army to take care of me after our parents died. He made sure that I went to college. He – uh, he paid for all of it, even though he had a hard time finding a job at first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did he do exactly?

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: He was a high end driver. Made a lot of deliveries.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything illegal?

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: I don’t know. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found a secret compartment in his car and we think that he might have been killed because of what was inside. Do you have any idea what he kept in there? Or maybe what he was doing in the garage this morning?

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: No. The last time that I spoke to him was yesterday. He said that he had to go meet someone named Falcon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. Beckett, Beckett, Beckett, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do I smell?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our witness is threatening to file a complaint against me for assault with a deadly odor. Says I smell like soiled baby diapers, and Javi’s cologne is, quote, “Satan’s butt sweat”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, yeah, it is pretty strong, but …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can you interview her? You always smell so pretty. Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. You and Espo dig into Justin’s life, though. See if you can find a connection to someone named Falcon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Captain Beckett. Thank you so much for coming in, Ms. Laszlo.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Let’s just get this over with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … so, what do you remember about the murder this morning?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Not much. I heard two gunshots and then a guy with a ski mask got on the elevator with me. I thought he was going to kill me, but he didn’t. Instead he got off at the ground level. I called 911 and left. Can I go home now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because I’m not done asking you questions just … yet.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Do you always eat kale for breakfast? Because that is just wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did … you know that I had kale this morning?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: You reek of it. Like this room stinks of grade D Greek food.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re very sensitive to smell.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Oh, you should change your name to Captain Obvious. It’s called hyperosmia. Look it up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so … what did our killer smell like?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Gosh … I don’t know. It was either puppies or gunpowder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you always this unpleasant?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Is there anything else you remember about the guy in the elevator?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: He was a white guy. He was about six feet tall, dark clothes, and he was carrying a silver briefcase that he got off of that dead guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, thank you very much. Well, the owner confirms it. The garage has no cameras.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And I’ve got uniforms pulling footage from surrounding areas.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like a well-oiled machine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s the exam results.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Moment of truth.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, bro. On three.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One, two –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: - two –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes! Sergeant Esposito right here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn, sorry bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t understand. How did you pass and I didn’t?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan. Next time, pal.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Espo! Way to go!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks! Ah, you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. How’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m – good. Um … you know, if you – if you just wait by the elevators Ryan and Espo will take you home.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: I’d rather French kiss a corpse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A uniform will drive you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She seems nice. What’s with the nose thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm … long story. Um … listen, I was – I was planning on calling you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Oh. Here I am. Roguishly handsome and at your service. What do you need?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … I was just hoping I could stop by the loft later on – – because I need to pick up the rest of my stuff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … absolutely. Any time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: She clearly has for the hots for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Captain Hoochie Mama. Her pheromone output went through the roof when she saw you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you know this how?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: I can smell it. Like I can smell you washed your hair with shaving cream this morning. And you chose day-old tacos over brushing your teeth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you a wizard?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: A cursed one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, you have hyperosmia. Just how heightened is your olfactory acuity?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: It’s off the charts. How do you –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I read a lot. You’re telling me you can tell exactly how Beckett feels about me just by her smell.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell you what. I have a brand new Ferrari downstairs. Smells like heaven. How about I give you a ride home and you can tell me a little more. Or Officer Julian here can give you a ride home and his favorite meal is sausages and chocolate milk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what I thought. Julian, I got this. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hayley! What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: Working.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She likes me a lot, too. You could probably tell.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re still looking into our victim’s phone records and social media but so far we haven’t found anyone named Falcon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But we did find a possible link to a company named The Falcon Unit. We’re checking that out now.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Why bother when I could just tell you who they are?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Somebody knows how to make an entrance.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hello all.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s up, girl? Nice to see you again. Great pants.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway, you were saying?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: The Falcon Unit. It’s a private company that specialized in transporting sensitive and occasionally illegal items for wealthy clients.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So our victim was a transporter. Like the movie?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That explains the armored sports car and secret compartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what was in the briefcase?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I’m afraid the answer to that comes with a price. I want in on the investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what’s in this for you?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: The item in the briefcase has a rather large insurance policy. The insurance company’s hired me to recover it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, this isn’t a treasure hunt. We’re trying to solve a homicide.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And your victim was killed for that briefcase, so – – you find your killer, I find my missing item, everyone goes home happy, hmm?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what was our victim hired to transport?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: A Van Gogh. Lost since World War Two. Purchased at auction three weeks ago for sixty-five million dollars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Long lost Van Gogh sold for a fortune. How come this wasn’t on the internet.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Painting has a complicated history. It was looted several times during the war, which made an above board sale impossible, so it was auctioned secretly in Zurich with potential buyers bidding remotely.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We should get a list of the other bidders. Maybe one of the losers tried to steal it.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I already tried. Auction house isn’t playing ball. I mean, they give up their clients, they lose their business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I’ll reach out to the State Department, see if they can apply a little pressure.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think I found our killer. An ATM camera caught a guy matching our witness’s description exiting the parking garage at 10:30.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s fifteen minutes after the murder. How come he was still around?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Probably stashing the briefcase.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Two minutes later a subway cam caught him hopping the F train. Now, his metro card was purchased with a credit card belonging to a Freddie Stark, a low level dirt bag with a history of B and E and violent assault.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nice job, Sarge.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Beckett and I have been married almost a year and things were going great and then suddenly she says she needs space.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Why is that my problem?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s not. But I – I was just thinking, you're so attuned to pheromone output you could help me with my interactions with Beckett. Let me know when I’m being charming. Let me know when I’m annoying her.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: You mean like this? "Hey Castle, you’re being annoying."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Only I’m thinking more like a secret hand gesture so she doesn’t – – you mean right now.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Yeah. Listen, you are actually fairly inoffensive on an odor level. But I am not a people person and I have zero interest in becoming one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me in. Let me convince you.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Forget it. No one goes inside but me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that … sounds lonely.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: It’s not. No. I – I’m not –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Five minutes. If I haven’t convinced you, you can just kick me out.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Fine. But you have to be decontaminated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you work from home.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: I consult for a perfume company as a professional nose, specializing in primal attraction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet you live alone and never have visitors.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: I see people. I go into the office once a week. It’s all I can handle. And besides, look what happens when you leave. You end up riding an elevator with a sweaty killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You could smell his sweat?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: And his gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What else.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bull. You’re a bloodhound. You just don’t want to get involved. But I’m betting you could identify this killer if you smelled him again. That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You an art fan, Freddy?

utterance.speaker: FREDDY STARK
utterance.content: I like comic books.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: How about Van Gogh?

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: I never heard of him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you at 10:15 this morning?

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: I was uptown walking my cat.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And yet we have proof that you were in the East Village committing a homicide.

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: Never happened. My cat hates the East Village.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … Captain?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um … it’s Castle. He’s on the phone. He says he’s got a break in the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How does he even know about this case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now is that any way to talk to the man who can ID your killer?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Wait, you can ID him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, no. But Mia can.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: No, I can’t.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Who’s Mia?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s an eyewitness. But technically she’s a … nose-witness.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Please put that down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She shared an elevator with our killer – – who was wearing a mask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that doesn’t matter. Because she can ID him by his smell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, she said he smelled like gunpowder. Look, I’m going to hang up. This isn’t time for party games.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: It’s not a party game.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Okay, then tell us something unique about the killer’s scent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: There was a hint of nail polish remover.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A six foot tall guy who smells like nail polish remover? This is a waste of time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hang on. Tell her the thing.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Okay. How about this? There was an old oil painting in that briefcase.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Are you slow? I smelled it.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Are you sure you want her back? Because I think you can do better –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, ah, ah. Beckett, we’re going to come down to the precinct.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! Castle –

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: I’m not going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, you are.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Why? Because you think I can help you get your wife back?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Well, ye- yes. But because a man was murdered this morning. And that man deserves justice. You know, you see your hyperosmia as a curse when really you’ve been given a great gift. And with your help the police can put away a cold-blooded killer. Now, isn’t that worth putting yourself out there?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: No. And there’s nothing you can do to make me leave my apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Desperate times call for desperate measures.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you’re right about those tacos.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: He’s not the killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If word gets out that I authorized a smell line up –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They have visual lineups for people who have seen killers, voice lineups for people who have heard them, - – but regardless, we know that Freddy was at the garage. And he’s clearly lying, so …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we lie to him. Tell him our witness ID’ed him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And watch him talk.

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not what our witness says.

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: Well what kind of lineup was that, anyway? The witness didn’t even look at my face.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Where’s the painting?

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: I don’t have it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cut the crap, Freddy. You got one chance to convince me that you’re not the murderer.

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: Okay, listen. I was at the garage. But not to kill the guy. I was hired to retrieve the painting.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: By who?

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: Tom Gilliam, out of the Falcon unit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s who hired Justin to transport it. Why would they want you to steal it from him?

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: I don’t know. But Gilliam was really upset when he hired me to hunt Justin down. Told me to do whatever it took to get the painting back. So I hacked the GPS in Justin’s car and followed him to the garage. But by the time I got there he was already dead and the painting was gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time did you get there?

utterance.speaker: FREDDY
utterance.content: I didn’t get to the garage until 10:20.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. Thanks. Captain confirms Freddy’s story.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So he arrived after Mia called 911.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which means, he ain’t our guy. So how do you want to go at this Falcon unit dude? I say we hit him hard. Guys like this only respond to intimidation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is that the way it’s going to be now? “I got this big promotion, I say we do it this way.”

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, hey. No, no. We can do it your way. How do you want to play it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I say we go at him hard.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Excuse me! Tom Gilliam! I’m Detective Ryan, this is Detective Esposito. We just have a few questions about the murder of Justin Fletcher.

utterance.speaker: TOM GILLIAM
utterance.content: A real tragedy, but I don’t know anything about it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s funny, because Freddy Stark says you do.

utterance.speaker: GILLIAM
utterance.content: How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you can start by telling us why you hired Freddy to steal that painting back from your own employee.

utterance.speaker: GILLIAM
utterance.content: You’ve got it all wrong. I didn’t hire Freddy to steal it. I hired him to retrieve it. Justin stole it from us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That doesn’t make sense. You hired Justin to transport the painting.

utterance.speaker: GILLIAM
utterance.content: No, I hired someone else. Transporters work on commission, payable on commission. The commission on that painting was six figures. Justin must have gotten greedy, jumped the job. We didn’t realize until the real transporter had arrived to pick up the painting and it was gone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then who’s the real transporter?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Liam Hollister. Ex-British mercenary. Kicked out of the French Foreign Legion for being too violent.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to Hayley, Liam is Falcon’s go-to guy for big money jobs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t think he’d take too kindly to Justin’s stealing his commission. Might go rogue.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So he tracked Justin to that garage and traded two bullets for that painting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You think he’d be rolling around in something more subtle after committing a murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, bro. Are we good?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, of course. Why do you even ask?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’ve been acting weird all day. And I know that you’re bummed, but you never even gave me props for passing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, Javi, you’re right, man. Congratulations, man. Really.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks, bro.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Go left.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, you okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No! You shot me in the ass!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You shot your partner.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: In the ass.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It was an accident. The hospital says he’s going to be fine. Just needs a few stitches.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: And a new pair of trousers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Any sign of Liam?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But he fled in his Rolls so we’ve got Vikram monitoring every street cam at every crossing in the city. Which means if he tries to get out of the city we will find him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I will coordinate with him, start digging into Liam’s life, try and figure out where he might go to ground.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You know Liam’s going to ditch the car, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: A ride like that would fetch top dollar. If Liam’s bolting he might want some quick cash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you calling?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Your husband. I reckon that he might have some friends who would know where to sell a hot Rolls in a hurry.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Why are you still here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The case isn’t over yet.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: It is for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw you back at the precinct. You were having fun.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: No, I wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Richard Castle. I’ll ask around. Okay. Okay, we have a new mission. To find where our suspect might sell a high-end Rolls Royce.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: I can’t help you with that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you can ID him once we get there.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Why are you doing this to me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because you helped me out. And now I’m returning the favor.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: By torturing me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Mia, you’re – you’re not living. You’re hiding. I know you find the world a little overwhelming. But out here, this is where life happens. So … … let’s go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, partner. Let me help you with that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can handle it myself.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, it was an accident.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, what are you doing here? Go home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m here to work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you were shot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s just a flesh wound. If he’s working then I’m working.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So I just got Liam’s phone records. He called Hawthorne Carter less than a half an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why does that name sound so familiar?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: He’s a hedge fund billionaire whose hobbies include world domination and art collection.

utterance.speaker: HAWTHORNE CARTER
utterance.content: Tell him the only way I’ll sell is if he lets me come down and punch him in the face. No, the drapes are gray –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Carter, you need to get off the phones.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll call you back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Both phones, please.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sit down or I will arrest you for conspiracy to commit murder.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Lorenzo, what is she talking about?

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: The Van Gogh, sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You bid on it at an auction and you lost. This morning it was stolen and a man was found shot to death.

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: Mr. Carter just got back from Singapore this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: We don’t think you killed him, but you are in contact with the man who did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Liam Hollister, a transporter. According to the Falcon Unit, you’ve engaged his services several times.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Yeah, he called looking to unload the painting. I only bid on it because Lorenzo thought it would look great hanging in my G5.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying you didn’t agree to buy it?

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Oh, no. I already bought a Jackson Pollock to hang there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any idea where he is now?

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Nope. But when I said no to the painting he asked if I had any interest in a used Rolls Royce.

utterance.speaker: MECHANIC
utterance.content: Yes, sir? How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, uh … Monty sent me.

utterance.speaker: MECHANIC
utterance.content: I see. So your Ferrari was stolen?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. And I’m afraid my poor insurance company’s going to have to pay out a fortune when I report it. Now, how much extra can I look forward to making?

utterance.speaker: MECHANIC
utterance.content: Well, I’m going to have to run some numbers, but I’ll see what our foreign buyers might pay for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, that looks like Liam’s car right there. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Love it. Want it. Need it.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: A convertible? Yuck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, why don’t you pop the trunk?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Oh. Okay.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, just taking a look at the cars.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: Yeah, back up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no problem.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: Hey! Get out of there!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. No need for that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mia?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Did I do okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did perfectly!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I give up. How the hell did the two of you trap Liam in his own trunk?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Because we’re awesome and you two suck. Next question?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened to you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Injured. In the line of duty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? How?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I … accidentally … shot him in the gluteus maximus.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the ass?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe I should give this to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, this is so not funny.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: You’re right. It’s hilarious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s hilarious! Come on, Mia, let’s make way for Crackshot Ryan and Ass-posito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Liam, NYPD. We’re about to open this trunk, so don’t do anything stupid.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: It wasn’t me!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I guess it wasn’t you who had the stolen painting in the silver briefcase.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I suppose it also wasn’t you who tried to kill us in that building.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: Oh, trust me. If I was trying to kill you you’d be dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: I was laying down a suppressive fire in order to get away. I aim to miss. Unlike you, mate. You shot your own partner in the ass. Blimey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, let’s – let’s not concern ourselves with who shot Detective Es – Espo – Detective Esposito. Sit down! Now! Sit down or I’m locking you up!

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Rather, let’s discuss how you shot Justin.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: I’m telling you it wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look, I get it. You were pissed. He jumped you on that transporter job, screwed you out of a big commission.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And then you tracked him down and you confronted him in that garage. You probably didn’t even mean to kill.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: I didn’t shoot Justin.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Cut that crap. All the evidence points to you.

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: Which is why I ran from you guys. Look, I was at that parking garage but when I left Justin was alive. It’s like you said. I confronted Justin. But he apologized. He knew he did me wrong so he gave me back the painting and I left. Someone else must have come after me and shot him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you really expect us to believe that?

utterance.speaker: HOLLISTER
utterance.content: No. But it’s the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: This case against Liam is pretty circumstantial.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, hopefully ballistics can match his gun to the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Yawn. I need food, now. And just so you know, when hungry, I do have a tendency to become irritable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You, irritable? I don’t believe it.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Beautiful, isn’t it? How long before I can return it to my employer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s up to the DA.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: It’s a forgery, you know.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know? You can smell it.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Oil paint takes many years to become fully dry. That smells way too fresh to be from the nineteenth century. It’s definitely not the painting that was in the killer’s briefcase.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe Liam was telling the truth?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If he was it would explain why Justin gave up the painting so easily. He knew it was a fake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means the real killer is still out there with the real painting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love it when there’s a twist.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: And I love it when my belly’s full.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m getting take-out right now.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Restaurant food? Hell no. Home cooking only. Everything has to be steamed. With zero, and I mean zero seasoning. If I even smell or see a speck of salt somebody’s going to get hurt. You’re my ride, Castle. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bon appetite, babe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mia, if you have a hankering for a bland meal I have a treat for you: my mother’s cooking.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: I heard that, Richard. I think gratitude would be appropriate, since I am steaming this ridiculous meal for you.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Martha Rodgers.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes. I’m sorry, have we met?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Uh, May 19th, 1999. I saw you perform in Pippin.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh my God. You remember that? Off off Broadway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Mother, that was New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s off off Broadway, as I said. Well, isn’t this nice. So, you liked the production?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: No. Hated it. Plus the theater smelled like Limburger gravy on a hot summer’s day. But you – you were amazing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? So all day with a best-selling author, nothing. Twenty seconds with my mother you’re a tweener at a Taylor Swift concert?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Don’t be a hater, Richard. It’s the power of theater. Go on, go on. You were raving.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Your performance, it was so moving that I completely forgot how horrible my real life was. It just – it was the best day ever.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: And you barely stink.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, coming from her that’s high praise.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett, I got something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I said.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s not what you said.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, that’s what I meant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you both get gold stars for the day if just one of you can tell me what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We – – did some digging into this painting’s tortured history.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stolen during World War II, it ended up in a private collection before coming up for auction.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Apparently stolen artwork like this rarely ends up in the hands of its owner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does any of this have to do with Justin’s murder?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Everything. The Van Gogh is connected to someone we know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two years ago there was a failed legal claim on behalf of the family who the painting was stolen from.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And guess who filed it?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, so glad you wanted a second helping.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Thank you, Martha. It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think my palate fell asleep.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, that’ll be the takeout for you and me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hell- Mother, what exactly did you order?

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, you’re coming with me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh no, he is not!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, it’s all right. Okay, so who are you?

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: My name’s not important. It’s who you are that is. You’re married to the Captain of the Twelfth Precinct, where a certain work of art is being held. You’re going to go and get it for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Give me one good reason why I should.

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: I’ll give you two.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Put the gun back to me. Point it back to me.

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: Look, that painting belongs to my family. My father spent his life trying to find it. He died a broken man. There’s no way I’m going to let it sit in some billionaire’s man cave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, I get it. I do. And I want to help you. Honestly. But I can’t get that painting even if I tried.

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: And why is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lucy’s not going to let me.

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: Who the hell is Lucy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s right behind you.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Technically I’m to his left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see that? Knocked him out with one punch!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And he wasn’t the only one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rick? Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Far from it. I think Mia is going to sue us for all we’ve got.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Yeah, you broke my money-maker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I said I was sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, uh, there’s more bad news. Lorenzo’s not our killer. I spoke with his co-workers. He’s got a rock solid alibi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that makes sense. If he was the one who killed Justin he’d already have the Van Gogh and wouldn’t have asked me to steal the fake one.

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: Hold on, the Van Gogh you recovered is the forgery?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know about the forgery? Lorenzo, you are in a world of trouble. Your best bet is to tell us everything you know. Now.

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: I have spent my entire adult life searching for that painting. When I heard it was coming up for auction I tried to get my boss to buy it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But he wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: No. But I knew Justin from some of his deliveries. I did some research, learned that we had three weeks before the painting was to be moved, so we hatched a plan. Justin would jump Liam’s transporter job and switch the Van Gogh with the fake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you provided the forgery?

utterance.speaker: LORENZO
utterance.content: No. From the very beginning Justin said he knew a guy. That’s why he went to the parking garage. To pick up the forged painting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoever forged that painting is the killer. He killed Justin for the real Van Gogh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But Justin gave Liam the fake in the parking garage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the exchange happened before Liam even arrived.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t mean the killer was gone. He could have just been hiding. What if Liam drove up just as the swap was taking place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then the killer would take cover.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. So Liam drives away with the forgery. The killer goes back out, kills Justin for the real one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a possibility. Then the question is, how do we identify this mystery man?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By his smell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well that’s a great idea, Castle, but you literally just broke the nose!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, it’s up to us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Justin parked here to meet with the forger, which means Liam must have driven in from over there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer must have headed away from here to avoid being spotted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you know, the stairwell’s the best option but that’s on the opposite side.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mia said the killer smelled like nail polish remover.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, which is unusual.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is that noise?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It sounds like an air conditioning unit on its last legs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nail polish remover smells like nail polish remover because its active ingredient, acetone. Air conditioning units leak. Specifically they leak Freon. Freon smells like acetone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: – like acetone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer must have been standing next to a Freon leak.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably squeezed up against this pillar, and that’s how he got the Freon transferred onto him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And uh … … this may very well be his hair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have the killer’s DNA.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks for coming back in, Graham.

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: No problem. So there was an update to my brother’s case?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Um … Justin. Now, he paid your college tuition, didn’t he? At the Art Institute.

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: What’s that have to do with anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we heard you were an amazing painter.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … gifted, according to your professors.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But a lousy gambler. Yeah, we checked. You had markers and IOUs all over the city.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: At underground casinos, the kind of establishments that don’t take kindly when you can’t pay up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I bet you thought it was your lucky day when your brother asked you to forge that Van Gogh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Justin was going to sell the original painting. The two of you would split the profits. But when you found out that he was just going to give that painting away you got a little pissed, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous. It doesn’t prove that I killed him, either.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. But the hair at the crime scene does. We ran the DNA. It’s a match to your brother by fifty-four percent. Also known as a sibling match.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now, you’re a gambling man. All right, so how much do you want to bet when we run that hair against the DNA from this glass there’s going to be an exact match?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And we have a warrant for your place. Now what are we going to find there? The gun that you used? The original Van Gogh?

utterance.speaker: GRAHAM
utterance.content: He was my brother. I – I didn’t want to kill him. I just – I needed the money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So can you tell the difference?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Uh … no. Not at all. Oh, I spoke to the current owner. Told him the whole story. And he pledged that he’s going to give it to the State Museum while Lorenzo’s family issue’s being adjudicated, so a bit of a happy ending.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it was a pleasure working with you.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah. You too. You’re not so bad for a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. You’re not so bad for a – – what – what exactly do you do?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, do you need any help?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not from you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, look. Could you find it in your heart to forgive me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re cool?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m so sorry. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, like you didn’t mean to do that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That was an accident!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, seems like there’s been a lot of accidents around here lately, Detective.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, it’s going to be like that, Sarge? Okay. Let’s make it even, then. An eye for an eye. A cheek for a cheek. Get your revenge. Shoot me in the ass. Go. Now. Shoot me in the ass. Come on. Do it right now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s squash this, right now. Just a quick pop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s playing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Come on, go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re embarrassing me –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Knock it off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he started it with his –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? If the two of you can’t figure this out on your own then you’re doing it in therapy and that’s an order. No ifs, ands, or buts. I didn’t mean it like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi … ow. Hi. How’re you feeling? Rather – – how are you smelling?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Oh, the doctor said my schnoz should go back to normal once the swelling goes down. Those for me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re paper so you don’t have to smell – I – I’m so sorry for everything.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Don’t. Come on. I did some pretty extraordinary things yesterday. And you were right; I haven’t been living. And thanks to you, now I will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, I think you’re going to like that card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a couple of tickets to my mother’s new play.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mia, I just think the world’s a better place with you running around in it.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: You know, you’re easier to be around when I can’t smell you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Beckett still loves you.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: With a passion. And you don’t have to measure pheromones to sense that.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: I’ve spent my career manufacturing the aroma of love for perfumes and colognes, but they’re all just forgeries. Like that painting.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: What you and Beckett have, now that’s the genuine article.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?
